title: R41249
content: Prior to 1996, health insurance coverage for mental illness was historically less generous than for physical illnesses, with lower limits, fewer covered services, and higher cost sharing. Mental health parity laws aim to provide equal coverage for mental health services compared to medical and surgical benefits. Mental health parity laws aim to provide equal insurance coverage for mental health services compared to medical and surgical benefits. Policymakers have developed three general approaches to achieving parity, based on coverage mandates and parity requirements. Federal mental health parity law prior to the ACA employed these approaches.
